00020 /// @file   TsvJoin.cpp
00021 /// @brief  Class for merging multiple tab separated text files.
00022 
00023 //
00024 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvJoin.h"
00025 //
00026 #include "util/Fs.h"
00027 #include "util/Guid.h"
00028 #include "util/Util.h"

00036 void define_tsvjoin_options(PgOptions* opts)
00037 {
00038   opts->setUsage("apt-tsv-join - Merge multiple tab separated text files into a single file.\n"
00039                  "Usage:\n"
00040                  "   apt-tsv-join -o data.txt -k column-name file1.txt file2.txt [...]");
00041 
00042   opts->defineOption("k", "key", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00043                      "Name of the column to use to join the various files.",
00044                      "");
00045   opts->defineOption("o", "out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00046                      "Output file to send the merged results to.",
00047                      "");
00048   opts->defineOption("p", "prepend-filename", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00049                      "Prepend the filename to the column header.",
00050                      "false");
00051   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00052                      "Display version information.",
00053                      "false");
00054   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00055                      "Print help message.",
00056                      "false");
00057 }
00058 
00059 /**
00060  *  @brief Constructor.
00061  *
00062  *  @param argc Number of command line arguments.
00063  *  @param argv Command line arguments.
00064  *  @param version Version string.
00065  *
00066  *  Errors: throw exception to display help messages, if too few input files.
00067 */
00068 tsvJoin::tsvJoin (int argc,
00069                   const char* argv[],
00070                   const std::string& version)
00071   : m_Version (version),
00072     m_StreamDataColCount(0),
00073     m_CommentLine ("############################################################\n")
00074 {
00075 
00076   // Prefer throw() to exit().
00077   Err::setThrowStatus (true);
00078 
00079   m_Opts = new PgOptions();
00080   define_tsvjoin_options(m_Opts);
00081   m_Opts->parseArgv(argv);
00082 
00083   // Optionally display usage message.
00084   if (m_Opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1)
00085   {
00086     m_Opts->usage();
00087     string msg = "version: " + version + "\n";
00088     cout << msg;
00089     exit(0);
00090   }
00091   // Optionally display version.
00092   if (m_Opts->getBool("version"))
00093   {
00094     string msg = "version: " + version + "\n";
00095     cout << msg;
00096     exit(0);
00097   }
00098 
00099   // Require key.
00100   m_Key = m_Opts->get("key");
00101   if (m_Key.empty())
00102   {
00103     string msg = "FATAL: Must provide --key option.";
00104     Err::errAbort (msg);
00105   }
00106   // Require at least two input files.
00107   m_FileCount = (unsigned int)m_Opts->getArgCount();
00108   if (m_FileCount < 2)
00109   {
00110     string msg = "FATAL: Must provide 2 or more files to merge.";
00111     Err::errAbort (msg);
00112   }
00113   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_FileCount; ++i)
00114     m_FileNames.push_back (string (m_Opts->getArg(i)));
00115 
00116   // Require writeable output file.
00117   m_Outfile = m_Opts->get("out-file");
00118   if (m_Outfile.empty())
00119   {
00120     string msg = "FATAL: Must provide -out-file output file.";
00121     Err::errAbort (msg);
00122   }
00123   else
00124     Fs::mustOpenToWrite(m_Out, m_Outfile);
00125 
00126   // Save prepend status.
00127   m_Prepend = m_Opts->getBool("prepend-filename");
00128 
00129   // The command line is copied to the output file header.
00130   assert (argc > 0);
00131   m_CommandLine = argv [0];
00132   for (int i = 1; i < argc; ++i)
00133     m_CommandLine += " " + string (argv [i]);
00134 }
00135 
00136 /**
00137  *  @brief Read, process data, write output.
00138  *
00139  *  Errors: abort if unable to read any input file.
00140 */
00141 void tsvJoin::run (void)
00142 {
00143   // Write initial output.
00144   beginOutput();
00145 
00146   // Open input files.
00147   openInputFiles();
00148 
00149   // Generate initial output header lines.
00150   beginOutputHeader();
00151 
00152   // Write file specific header lines.
00153   unsigned int idx = 0;
00154   writeHeadersFromFile (m_StreamTsv, idx, m_StreamColNames);
00155   for (idx = 0; idx < m_FileCount - 1; ++idx)
00156     writeHeadersFromFile (*m_IndexTsvs[idx], idx + 1, m_IndexColNames[idx]);
00157   m_Out << m_CommentLine;
00158 
00159   // Write matching lines.
00160   writeMatches();
00161 
00162   // Close output file.
00163   m_Out.close();
00164 }
00165 
00166 /**
00167  *  @brief Begin output.
00168 */
00169 void tsvJoin::beginOutput (void)
00170 {
00171   Verbose::out (1, "MODULE: " + m_Version);
00172   Verbose::out (1, "CMD: " + m_CommandLine);
00173   m_ExecGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00174   Verbose::out (1, "exec_guid " + m_ExecGuid);
00175 }

00177 /**
00178  *  @brief Open input files.
00179  *
00180  *  Errors: abort if a file could not be opened or if
00181  *  the key column name was not found.
00182 */
00183 void tsvJoin::openInputFiles (void)
00184 {
00185   string& streamFileName = m_FileNames[0];
00186   Verbose::out (1, "Opening stream file " + streamFileName + ".");
00187   if (m_StreamTsv.open (streamFileName) != TSV_OK)
00188     Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + streamFileName);
00189   // Allow comment lines within data.
00190   m_StreamTsv.m_optAllowDataComment = true;
00191 
00192   bool foundKey = false;
00193   unsigned int colCount = m_StreamTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00194   m_StreamDataColCount = colCount - 1;
00195   m_StreamColNames.resize (colCount);
00196 
00197   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < colCount; ++i)
00198   {
00199     string colName;
00200     m_StreamTsv.cidx2cname (0, i, colName);
00201     m_StreamColNames[i] = colName;
00202     if (colName == m_Key)
00203     {
00204       m_StreamTsv.bind (0, i, &m_StreamKeyValue);
00205       foundKey = true;
00206     }
00207   }
00208   // Abort if key not found.
00209   if (! foundKey)
00210     Err::errAbort ("Key " + m_Key + " not found in file " + streamFileName);
00211 
00212   // Bind to data vector after checking column names - binds must follow
00213   // resize(), which may trigger reallocation, which would invalidate the
00214   // addresses passed in the bind.
00215   m_StreamData.resize (colCount - 1);
00216   unsigned int k = 0;
00217   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < colCount; ++i)
00218   {
00219     string colName;
00220     m_StreamTsv.cidx2cname (0, i, colName);
00221     if (colName != m_Key)
00222       m_StreamTsv.bind (0, i, &m_StreamData[k++]);
00223   }
00224 
00225   // Required in the constructor that at least two input file names were provided.
00226   assert (m_FileCount > 1);
00227   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_FileCount - 1; ++i)
00228   {
00229     string& indexFileName = m_FileNames[i + 1];
00230     Verbose::out (1, "Opening file " + indexFileName + " for indexing.");
00231     TsvFile* indexTsv = new TsvFile;
00232     if (indexTsv->open (indexFileName) != TSV_OK)
00233       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + indexFileName);
00234     indexTsv->m_optAllowDataComment = true;
00235     m_IndexTsvs.push_back (indexTsv);
00236 
00237     colCount = indexTsv->getColumnCount(0);
00238     m_IndexColNames.push_back (vector<string> (colCount));
00239     m_IndexData.push_back (vector<string> (colCount - 1));
00240 
00241     foundKey = false;
00242     k = 0;
00243     for (unsigned int j = 0; j < colCount; ++j)
00244     {
00245       string colName;
00246       indexTsv->cidx2cname (0, j, colName);
00247       m_IndexColNames[i][j] = colName;
00248       if (colName == m_Key)
00249         foundKey = true;
00250     }
00251     if (! foundKey)
00252       Err::errAbort ("Key " + m_Key + " not found in file " + indexFileName);
00253 
00254     // Set up index.
00255     indexTsv->defineIndex (0, m_Key, TSV_INDEX_STRING, 0);
00256 
00257     // Remember the number of data columns.
00258     m_IndexDataColCount.push_back (colCount - 1);
00259 
00260   }  // end for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_FileCount - 1; ++i)
00261 
00262   // Bind to the data vectors after setting up them up: push_back()
00263   // and resize() may cause reallocation, which will change the addresses.
00264   m_IndexKeyValues.resize (m_FileCount - 1);
00265   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_FileCount - 1; ++i)
00266   {
00267     TsvFile* indexTsv = m_IndexTsvs[i];
00268     k = 0;
00269     // Add one since had stored number of data columns.
00270     unsigned int colCount = m_IndexDataColCount[i] + 1;
00271     for (unsigned int j = 0; j < colCount; ++j)
00272     {
00273       string colName;
00274       indexTsv->cidx2cname (0, j, colName);
00275       if (colName == m_Key)
00276         indexTsv->bind (0, j, &m_IndexKeyValues[i]);
00277       else
00278         indexTsv->bind (0, j, &m_IndexData[i][k++]);
00279     }
00280   }
00281 }

00283 /**
00284  *  @brief Begin output file header.
00285 */
00286 void tsvJoin::beginOutputHeader (void)
00287 {
00288   const string guid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00289   m_Out << "#%guid=" << guid << "\n";
00290   m_Out << "#%exec_guid=" << m_ExecGuid << "\n";
00291   m_Out << "#%exec_version=" << m_Version << "\n";
00292   m_Out << "#%create_date=" << Util::getTimeStamp() << "\n";
00293   m_Out << "#%cmd=" << m_CommandLine << "\n";
00294 }
00295 
00296 /**
00297  *  @brief Write header lines copied from input file.
00298 */
00299 void tsvJoin::writeHeadersFromFile (TsvFile& tsv, const unsigned int idx,
00300                                     std::vector<std::string>& columnNames)
00301 {
00302   m_Out << m_CommentLine;
00303   headerLine (idx);
00304   m_Out << "name=" << m_FileNames[idx] << "\n";
00305   headerLine (idx);
00306   m_Out << "cols=";
00307   const unsigned int colCount = columnNames.size();
00308   // Need the key column at least.
00309   assert (colCount > 0);
00310   m_Out << columnNames[0];
00311   for (unsigned int i = 1; i < colCount; ++i)
00312     m_Out << "," << columnNames[i];
00313   m_Out << "\n";
00314 
00315   // Finished with the key column name - delete it.
00316   columnNames.erase (remove (columnNames.begin(), columnNames.end(), m_Key), columnNames.end());
00317 
00318   // Copy file header meta tags to output.
00319   string key, value;
00320   tsv.headersBegin();
00321   while (tsv.headersNext (key, value) == TSV_OK)
00322     // Comment lines among the headers give rise to a pair with a null key.
00323     if (! key.empty())
00324     {
00325       headerLine (idx);
00326       m_Out << key << "=" << value << "\n";
00327     }
00328 }
00329 
00330 /**
00331  *  @brief Write output column names.
00332 */
00333 void tsvJoin::writeColumnNames (void)
00334 {
00335   // Key first.
00336   m_Out << m_Key;
00337 
00338   // Remaining columns of the stream file.
00339   const unsigned int streamColCount = m_StreamColNames.size();
00340   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < streamColCount; ++i)
00341     // Write key only once.
00342     if (m_StreamColNames[i] != m_Key)
00343     {
00344       m_Out << "\t";
00345       // Prepend file name if requested.
00346       if (m_Prepend)
00347         m_Out << m_FileNames[0] << ": ";
00348       m_Out << m_StreamColNames[i];
00349     }
00350 
00351   // Remaining columns of index files.
00352   // The key column name has already been deleted, in writeHeadersFromFile().
00353   for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < m_FileCount - 1; ++idx)
00354   {
00355     const unsigned int indexColCount = m_IndexColNames[idx].size();
00356     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < indexColCount; ++i)
00357     {
00358       m_Out << "\t";
00359       if (m_Prepend)
00360         m_Out << m_FileNames[idx + 1] << ": ";
00361       m_Out << m_IndexColNames[idx][i];
00362     }
00363   }
00364   m_Out << "\n";
00365 }
00366 
00367 /**
00368  *  @brief Write matching lines.
00369 */
00370 void tsvJoin::writeMatches (void)
00371 {
00372   Verbose::out (1, "Done indexing files. Generating merged file.");
00373 
00374   // Write column names only if find at least one match.
00375   bool columnNamesWritten = false;
00376 
00377   // Read stream file.
00378   while (m_StreamTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00379   {
00380     bool foundMatch = false;
00381     // Look for matches in each index file.
00382     for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < m_FileCount - 1; ++idx)
00383     {
00384       TsvFile* indexTsv = m_IndexTsvs[idx];
00385       if (indexTsv->findBegin (0, m_Key, TSV_OP_EQ, m_StreamKeyValue) != TSV_OK)
00386         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading index file " + m_FileNames[idx + 1]);
00387 
00388       const int resultCount = indexTsv->findResultsCount();
00389       // Require a match in all index files.
00390       if (resultCount == 0)
00391       {
00392         foundMatch = false;
00393         break;
00394       }
00395       // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00396       else if (resultCount > 1)
00397       {
00398         string msg = "FATAL: key '" + m_Key + "' is not a unique index. Duplicate key found, [";
00399         msg += m_StreamKeyValue + "] for file " + m_FileNames[idx + 1] + ".";
00400         Err::errAbort (msg);
00401       }
00402       // Found one match - read data
00403       if (indexTsv->findNext() != TSV_OK)
00404         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading index file " + m_FileNames[idx + 1]);
00405       foundMatch = true;
00406     } // end for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < m_FileCount - 1; ++idx)
00407 
00408     if (foundMatch)
00409     {
00410       // Found match - write column names once.
00411       if (! columnNamesWritten)
00412       {
00413         writeColumnNames();
00414         columnNamesWritten = true;
00415       }
00416       // Write key.
00417       m_Out << m_StreamKeyValue;
00418 
00419       // Write columns from stream file.
00420       for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_StreamDataColCount; ++i)
00421         m_Out << "\t" << m_StreamData[i];
00422 
00423       // Write columns from index files.
00424       for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < m_FileCount - 1; ++idx)
00425       {
00426         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_IndexDataColCount[idx]; ++i)
00427           m_Out << "\t" << m_IndexData[idx][i];
00428       }
00429       m_Out << "\n";
00430     } // end if (foundMatch)
00431   } // end while (m_StreamTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00432 }

00434 /** Destructor.
00435  */
00436 tsvJoin::~tsvJoin()
00437 {
00438   clear();
00439 }

00441 /** Clear data.
00442  */
00443 void tsvJoin::clear()
00444 {
00445   delete m_Opts;
00446   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_IndexTsvs.size(); ++i)
00447     {
00448       m_IndexTsvs[i]->close();
00449       delete m_IndexTsvs[i];
00450     }
00451 }
00452 
00453 void tsvJoin::headerLine (const unsigned int i)
00454 {
00455   m_Out << "#%file" << i << "_";
00456 }
